alert.note: Alert for Brown (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 28 at 4:01PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. Brief heavy rainfall with up to one inch is expected, in a short period of time. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Brown. * WHEN...Until 500 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Some street flooding is likely in Brownwood. Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 359 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Brownwood, Early, Camp Bowie and Owens. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Gifford at Beaver, Austin Street at Avenue G, Belle Plain at Romines, Good Shephard at 11th, Indian Creek at 9th, Willis at Belmeade, Magnolia at Belmeade, 4th Street at Wood, Cordell at Anderson and Austin Street at Avenue J. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
